alert.note: Alert for Atascosa; Bexar; Comal; Guadalupe; Wilson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 1:11AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Guadalupe, northwestern Atascosa, northwestern Wilson, Bexar and Comal Counties through 215 AM CDT... At 111 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Bergheim to 6 miles north of Poteet. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... San Antonio, New Braunfels, Schertz, Seguin, Cibolo, Universal City, Live Oak, Selma, Floresville, Poth, Stinson Municipal Airport, San Antonio Int Airport, Randolph AFB, Canyon Lake, Leon Valley, Helotes, Fair Oaks Ranch, Kirby, Alamo Heights and Windcrest. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for south central Texas.
